result.execSummary:
The defendant Simme A Harrison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim witness surcharges, and DNA surcharge, are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 7/10/16.  Nonpayment  penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program and a parenting program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (19 pages) commencing JULY 10, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Simme A Harrison in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant Simme A Harrison in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by: Erica S.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/10/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/10/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Simme A Harrison in court with attorney Mark S Tishberg.  Defendant Simme A Harrison in custody.  Patrick M Harvey appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 7/10/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Mark S Tishberg in court, defendant Simme A Harrison not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 6/12/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Mark S Tishberg in court, defendant Simme A Harrison not in court, in custody.  No A Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense needs an offer from the State. Case calendared for STATUS on 5/1/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Simme A Harrison in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant Simme A Harrison in custody.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Simme A Harrison in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Simme A Harrison in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Simme A Harrison
Current: 4924 N 24th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 04-01-2014)
Prior: 8810 West Silver Spring Drive #3, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
